River levels have risen at the Bulwell river gauge. as a result of Storm BABET. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 19:00, tonight 19/10/23   
Areas most at risk are low-lying recreational areas and roads including High School playing fields on Valley Road and other low lying land and recreational areas, low lying land and roads around the Tottle Brook.   
Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. River levels will continue to rise over the weekend.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area and liaising with emergency services. 
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 09:00 on 20/10/23, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Coast from Silloth to St Bees
North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including tidal River Esk
items.message:
Storm Babet is forecast to produce large waves and spray overtopping on the coast tomorrow morning, 20/10/2023.

Flooding is possible at The North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including Sandsend and the tidal River Esk between 05:00 AM and 11:30 AM on 20/10/2023.

We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 3 days and as a result we may issue further alerts for subsequent tides on Friday and Saturday.

Our incident room is open and we are closely monitoring the situation.

Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.

This message will be updated by 1:00 PM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

Flood alert area: The North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including Sandsend and tidal River Esk.

items.description: River Erewash and Boundary Brook at Trowell and Stapleford Moorbridge Lane
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Trowel gauge as a result of Storm BABET.  Consequently, flooding of property is expected to begin between 06:45 and 7:45 today, 20/10/23.  Areas most at risk are Trowell and Stapleford from the Boundary Brook, including Cranbourne Close, Trowell Park Drive, Need Wood Avenue and Roehampton Drive. 
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until 06:00 on 21/10/23.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area and liaising with emergency services.  
  
This message will be updated 14:30 20/10/23

items.description: River Maun at Edwinstowe and Ollerton
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Mansfield The Dykes river gauge, as a result of Storm BABET. Consequently, flooding of property/roads and farmland is possible.
Areas most at risk are Edwinstowe and Ollerton.   
Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. River levels will continue to rise over the weekend.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area and liaising with emergency services. 
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated this afternoon on 20/10/23, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
"River levels are forecast to rise at the Pinxton gauge as a result of Storm BABET.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 19:00, tonight 19/10/23. 
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Pinxton, including the Pinxton Wharf access road, Langley Mill, Ilkeston, Stapleford, and the recreation area at Sandiacre.       
Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  River levels will continue to rise over the weekend.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area and liaising with emergency services. 
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 09:00 on 20/10/23, or as the situation changes."

items.description: River Maun at Haughton, Milton and West Drayton
items.message:
River levels have fallen below the flood warning threshold but will rise again by tomorrow early morning at the Whitewater Bridge river gauge as a result of Storm Babet.  
Consequently, the risk of flooding remains.  Areas most at risk are Haughton, Milton and West Drayton.   
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 20/10/23, or as the situation changes

We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 3 days and as a result we may issue further alerts for subsequent tides on Friday and Saturday.

Our incident room is open and we are closely monitoring the situation.

items.description: North Sea coast at Bridlington - Harbour Road and Floral Pavilion
items.message:
Storm Babet is forecast to produce large waves and spray overtopping on the coast this morning, 20/10/2023.

Areas most at risk include the north side of the dock area, properties on Harbour Road and the Floral Pavilion from 04:00 AM on 20/10/2023. Overtopping waves and spray could affect these areas throughout today (20/10/2023) and into tomorrow (21/10/2023).

We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 3 days and as a result we may issue further warnings for subsequent tides today (20/10/2023) and into tomorrow (21/10/2023).

Our incident room is open and we are closely monitoring the situation.

Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.

This message will be updated by 1:00 PM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

River levels continue to rise on the upper River Wharfe due to overnight rainfall associated with Storm Babet. Flooding is possible on low lying land near the River Wharfe and tributaries. Confidence of locations most at risk is currently low. We will update this message as details become clear. Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughout Friday, 20/10/2023. Our incident room is open and we are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 16:00hrs on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes. items.description: Tyne estuary at North Shields, South Shields and Howdon Pans
items.message:
Storm Babet is forecast to bring strong winds, large waves and spray overtopping on the coast. This Flood Warning has been issued due to the high tide forecast between 06:00 AM and 09:00 AM on 20/10/2023.

Areas most at risk include Properties at Fish Market, Bell Street, Dolphin Quay, Union Quay, Clive Street, Duke Street, Liddell Street, Corporation Quay, South Shields Ferry Landing, Wapping Street, Tyne Dock, Albert Edward Dock, Tyne Foyboatmen Association and Howdon Pans.

We will continue to monitor levels closely. Please stay away from beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as the expected large waves and sea spray will be dangerous. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Devon and Smite in Leicestershire and Nottinghamshire
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Colston Bassett river gauge, as a result of Storm BABET. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 19:00, tonight 19/10/23       
Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads along the River Smite. Church Gate and Bunnison Lane in Colston Bassett could be impassable, with potentially dangerous depths of flood water.  Areas around the River Devon could also be affected at Easthorpe, Bottesford, Belvoir Lane and the Woolsthorpe to Belvoir road in Woolsthorpe, Church Lane and Main Street in Muston.   
Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. River levels will continue to rise over the weekend.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area and liaising with emergency services.

Areas most at risk include The Tidal River Wharfe downstream of Tadcaster. Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughtout the day, Friday 20/10/2023. Our incident rooms are open and we are closely monitoring the situation.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels are rising on the River Wharfe due to Storm Babet. Further heavy rainfall is forecast throughout the day, Friday 20/10/2023. Our incident rooms are open and we are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 20/10/2023, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Mansfield Pleasley Chesterfield Road North river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding (of property) is imminent.  Areas most at risk are Chesterfield Road and Meden Square, to the east of Pleasley Bridge.   
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. River levels will continue to rise over the weekend.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area and liaising with emergency services.  
Please avoid contact with flood water and move possessions and valuables off the ground or to safety.  
This message will be updated by 17:00 this afternoon, 20/10/23, or as the situation changes.
